review: I LOVE this thing, when it works.  And honestly it works, most of the time.  It has a weird habit of randomly dropping the internet connection and then refusing to reconnect until I put it to "sleep" and then "wake" it up again, but this is a minor annoyance.  When I bought it I wasn't sure that I would really use it.  I had my old PS3 in the bedroom which was perfectly capable of watching Netflix and Prime Video, and most of the other things the Fire TV Stick does, and I had my PS4 in the living room capable of the same things.  But the real advantage came in ease of use, noise, and portability.  The Fire TV Stick remote is a much simpler interface than either iteration of the Playstation, and with the app installed on my phone I can control it even when the little remote comes up missing for a few days here and there (my kids usually blame the dog for this).  It is also completely silent, thanks to no spinning hard drive or whirring fan (this is a big help for late night binge watching in the bedroom while my wife tries to sleep, that PS3 is a noisy machine)!  Last but certainly not least, portability.  You can take it anywhere.  It's small, virtually weightless, and pretty much plug and play.  As long as you have a TV with an HDMI port, a power outlet and a WiFi connection you can access this thing is ready to go.  It remembers your account information, so aside from setting up the new WiFi connection there is no complicated login and setup process.
